title: ICCV_2001_47_abs

sentences.text: We propose to incorporate a priori geometric constraints in a 3 -- D stereo reconstruction scheme to cope with the many cases where image information alone is not sufficient to accurately recover 3 -- D shape .
Our approach is based on the iterative deformation of a 3 -- D surface mesh to minimize an objective function .
We show that combining anisotropic meshing with a non-quadratic approach to regularization enables us to obtain satisfactory reconstruction results using triangulations with few vertices .
Structural or numerical constraints can then be added locally to the reconstruction process through a constrained optimization scheme .
They improve the reconstruction results and enforce their consistency with a priori knowledge about object shape .
The strong description and modeling properties of differential features make them useful tools that can be efficiently used as constraints for 3 -- D reconstruction .

Entity-a_priori_geometric_constraint.label: a priori geometric constraints
Entity-a_priori_geometric_constraint.description: A priori geometric constraints refer to predefined rules or knowledge about the shape and structure of objects that are utilized in 3-D stereo reconstruction to enhance the accuracy of shape recovery when image data is insufficient.

Entity-a_constrained_optimization_scheme.label: a constrained optimization scheme
Entity-a_constrained_optimization_scheme.description: A constrained optimization scheme refers to a method used in the 3-D stereo reconstruction process that incorporates structural or numerical constraints to enhance the accuracy and consistency of the reconstructed 3-D shape by minimizing an objective function.

Entity-our_approach.label: Our approach
Entity-our_approach.description: Our approach refers to a methodology for 3-D stereo reconstruction that utilizes iterative deformation of a 3-D surface mesh to minimize an objective function, incorporating a priori geometric constraints to enhance accuracy and consistency in shape recovery.

Entity-non-quadratic_approach.label: non-quadratic approach
Entity-non-quadratic_approach.description: The 'non-quadratic approach' refers to a method of regularization used in 3-D stereo reconstruction that enhances the reconstruction results by minimizing an objective function through the iterative deformation of a 3-D surface mesh, particularly when combined with anisotropic meshing.

Entity-iterative_deformation_of_a_3_--_d.label: iterative deformation of a 3 -- D surface mesh
aliases: iterative deformation of a 3 -- D surface mesh
Entity-iterative_deformation_of_a_3_--_d.description: The iterative deformation of a 3-D surface mesh refers to a computational process used in 3-D stereo reconstruction that involves progressively adjusting the vertices of a mesh to minimize an objective function, thereby improving the accuracy of the reconstructed 3-D shape by incorporating geometric constraints.

mentions.local_name: iterative deformation of a 3 -- D surface mesh

Entity-reconstruction_result.label: reconstruction results
Entity-reconstruction_result.description: The term 'reconstruction results' refers to the outcomes of a 3-D stereo reconstruction process that utilizes a combination of anisotropic meshing and non-quadratic regularization techniques to achieve satisfactory 3-D shape recovery from limited image data.

Entity-numerical_constraint.label: numerical constraints
Entity-numerical_constraint.description: Numerical constraints refer to specific limitations or conditions applied to the parameters of a constrained optimization scheme in the context of 3-D stereo reconstruction, aimed at enhancing the accuracy and consistency of the reconstructed shape with prior geometric knowledge.

Entity-iterative_deformation.label: iterative deformation
Entity-iterative_deformation.description: Iterative deformation refers to a mathematical process used in 3-D stereo reconstruction that involves the repeated adjustment of a 3-D surface mesh to minimize an objective function, thereby improving the accuracy of shape recovery.

Entity-triangulation.label: triangulations
Entity-triangulation.description: Triangulations refer to a type of geometric structure used in 3-D surface meshes, consisting of triangular elements that facilitate the reconstruction of 3-D shapes by minimizing an objective function in stereo reconstruction schemes.

Entity-reconstruction_process.label: reconstruction process
Entity-reconstruction_process.description: The reconstruction process refers to the iterative method of deforming a 3-D surface mesh to accurately recover 3-D shape by incorporating a priori geometric constraints and optimizing an objective function.

Entity-structural_or_numerical_constrain.label: structural or numerical constraints
Entity-structural_or_numerical_constrain.description: Structural or numerical constraints refer to specific limitations or requirements that can be applied during the 3-D reconstruction process to enhance the accuracy and consistency of the reconstructed shape with prior geometric knowledge.

Entity-triangulation_with_few_vertex.label: triangulations with few vertices
Entity-triangulation_with_few_vertex.description: Triangulations with few vertices refer to simplified 3D surface meshes that utilize a limited number of triangular elements to represent complex shapes, facilitating effective 3D stereo reconstruction while incorporating geometric constraints and optimization techniques.

Entity-3_--_d_shape.label: 3 -- D shape
Entity-3_--_d_shape.description: The term '3 -- D shape' refers to a three-dimensional geometric representation of an object that is reconstructed using stereo imaging techniques and geometric constraints to enhance accuracy in modeling its form.

Entity-3_--_d_stereo_reconstruction_sche.label: 3 -- D stereo reconstruction scheme
Entity-3_--_d_stereo_reconstruction_sche.description: A 3D stereo reconstruction scheme is a method used to create a three-dimensional representation of a scene or object from two-dimensional images by analyzing the disparity between the images.

Entity-satisfactory_reconstruction_resul.label: satisfactory reconstruction results
Entity-satisfactory_reconstruction_resul.description: Satisfactory reconstruction results refer to the effective and accurate recovery of 3D shapes achieved through the integration of geometric constraints and advanced meshing techniques in a 3D stereo reconstruction framework.

Entity-object_shape.label: object shape
Entity-object_shape.description: The term 'object shape' refers to the geometric configuration or form of an object that is utilized as a prior knowledge constraint in 3-D stereo reconstruction processes to enhance the accuracy and consistency of the reconstructed models.

Entity-anisotropic_meshing.label: anisotropic meshing
Entity-anisotropic_meshing.description: Anisotropic meshing is a geometric modeling technique that generates mesh structures with varying element sizes and shapes, optimized for accurately representing complex geometries and improving computational efficiency in simulations.

Entity-3_--_d_reconstruction.label: 3 -- D reconstruction
Entity-3_--_d_reconstruction.description: 3D reconstruction refers to the process of capturing the shape and appearance of a physical object or environment to create a three-dimensional model using various techniques and technologies.

Entity-a_priori_knowledge_about_object_s.label: a priori knowledge about object shape
aliases: a priori knowledge about object shape
Entity-a_priori_knowledge_about_object_s.description: A priori knowledge about object shape refers to the pre-existing geometric information and constraints regarding the form of objects that is utilized to enhance the accuracy of 3-D shape reconstruction in computer vision.

mentions.local_name: a priori knowledge about object shape

Entity-differential_feature.label: differential features
Entity-differential_feature.description: Differential features refer to specific geometric properties that provide strong descriptive and modeling capabilities, making them effective constraints in the context of 3-D reconstruction processes.

Entity-3_--_d_surface_mesh.label: 3 -- D surface mesh
Entity-3_--_d_surface_mesh.description: A 3D surface mesh is a geometric representation composed of vertices, edges, and faces that defines the shape of a three-dimensional object in space.

Entity-constrained_optimization_scheme.label: constrained optimization scheme
Entity-constrained_optimization_scheme.description: A constrained optimization scheme is a mathematical method used to find the best solution to a problem while adhering to specific limitations or constraints.

Entity-geometric_constraint.label: geometric constraints
Entity-geometric_constraint.description: Geometric constraints are mathematical conditions that restrict the possible configurations or relationships of geometric entities in a given space, often used to ensure valid solutions in various applications such as computer graphics, robotics, and computer vision.

Entity-image_information.label: image information
Entity-image_information.description: Image information refers to the visual data derived from images that is utilized in 3-D stereo reconstruction processes, which may not be adequate on its own for accurately recovering 3-D shapes without additional geometric constraints.

Entity-their_consistency.label: their consistency
Entity-their_consistency.description: The term 'their consistency' refers to the alignment and adherence of the 3-D reconstruction results with the a priori geometric constraints and knowledge about the object's shape.

Entity-regularization.label: regularization
Entity-regularization.description: Regularization is a mathematical technique used to prevent overfitting in models by introducing additional information or constraints.

Entity-vertex.label: vertices
Entity-vertex.description: Vertices are fundamental geometric points in a mesh or geometric structure that define the corners or intersections of shapes.

Entity-objective_function.label: objective function
Entity-objective_function.description: An objective function is a mathematical function that quantifies the goal of an optimization problem, typically representing the value to be minimized or maximized.

Entity-a_priori_knowledge.label: a priori knowledge
Entity-a_priori_knowledge.description: A priori knowledge refers to information or understanding that is independent of experience and is derived from theoretical reasoning or logical deduction.

summary: We propose to incorporate a priori geometric constraints in a 3 -- D stereo reconstruction scheme to cope with the many cases where image information alone is not sufficient to accurately recover 3 -- D shape . Our approach is based on the iterative deformation of a 3 -- D surface mesh to minimize an objective function . We show that combining anisotropic meshing with a non-quadratic approach to regularization enables us to obtain satisfactory reconstruction results using triangulations with few vertices . Structural or numerical constraints can then be added locally to the reconstruction process through a constrained optimization scheme . They improve the reconstruction results and enforce their consistency with a priori knowledge about object shape . The strong description and modeling properties of differential features make them useful tools that can be efficiently used as constraints for 3 -- D reconstruction .

Predicate-incorporate_in.label: incorporate in
Predicate-incorporate_in.description: The predicate 'incorporate in' signifies the action of integrating or including a subject within a broader context or framework represented by the object. It implies that the subject contributes to or becomes part of the object, enhancing its functionality, structure, or understanding.

Predicate-is_not_sufficient_to_recover.label: is not sufficient to recover
Predicate-is_not_sufficient_to_recover.description: The predicate 'is not sufficient to recover' indicates that the subject lacks the necessary qualities, details, or components to fully restore or recreate the object. It implies a deficiency in the subject's ability to provide the complete or accurate representation of the object, suggesting that additional information or resources are required for a successful recovery.

Predicate-is_not_sufficient_to_accuratel.label: is not sufficient to accurately recover
Predicate-is_not_sufficient_to_accuratel.description: The predicate 'is not sufficient to accurately recover' indicates that the subject lacks the necessary qualities, details, or completeness to fully restore or represent the object in a precise manner. It suggests a deficiency in the subject's ability to convey or reproduce the object as intended, highlighting a gap between what is available and what is required for an accurate representation.

Predicate-is_based_on.label: is based on
Predicate-is_based_on.description: The predicate 'is based on' establishes a foundational relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject derives its principles, methods, or framework from the object. It suggests that the subject's validity, functionality, or effectiveness is contingent upon the underlying concepts or processes represented by the object.

Predicate-minimizes.label: minimizes
Predicate-minimizes.description: The predicate 'minimizes' indicates a relationship where the subject actively reduces the value or impact of the object, typically in the context of optimization. It suggests that the subject's actions or processes are aimed at achieving the lowest possible level of the object, which is often a measurable quantity or function representing a goal or criterion. This relationship implies a directional influence where the subject's behavior is intended to enhance efficiency or effectiveness by lowering the object.

Predicate-minimize.label: minimize
Predicate-minimize.description: The predicate 'minimize' denotes an action or process whereby the subject seeks to reduce the value or impact of the object, typically an objective function or criterion. This involves optimizing the subject's parameters or characteristics to achieve the lowest possible outcome for the object, thereby enhancing efficiency, performance, or effectiveness in a given context.

Predicate-combines_with.label: combines with
Predicate-combines_with.description: The predicate 'combines with' indicates a relationship where the subject and object are brought together or integrated in a way that enhances or creates a new entity, concept, or process. This relationship suggests that both elements contribute distinct characteristics or functionalities that, when merged, result in a synergistic effect or a more complex system.

Predicate-enables.label: enables
Predicate-enables.description: The predicate 'enables' indicates that the subject provides the means, capability, or opportunity for the object to occur or be achieved. It suggests a facilitative relationship where the subject contributes positively to the realization or attainment of the object.

Predicate-uses.label: uses
Predicate-uses.description: The predicate 'uses' indicates a relationship where the subject employs, utilizes, or applies the object as a resource, tool, or component in a process or function. It signifies that the subject actively engages with the object to achieve a specific purpose or outcome.

Predicate-produces.label: produces
Predicate-produces.description: The predicate 'produces' indicates a causal or generative relationship where the subject is responsible for creating, generating, or yielding the object. It implies that the subject's characteristics or actions lead to the existence or manifestation of the object, suggesting a process of transformation or output resulting from the subject's input or properties.

Predicate-are_used_for.label: are used for
Predicate-are_used_for.description: The predicate 'are used for' indicates a functional relationship where the subject serves a specific purpose or application that is fulfilled by the object. It connects the subject, which represents a method, tool, or concept, to the object, which denotes the outcome, result, or context in which the subject is applied.

Predicate-enables_to_obtain.label: enables to obtain
Predicate-enables_to_obtain.description: The predicate 'enables to obtain' indicates a facilitative relationship where the subject provides the means, methods, or conditions necessary for achieving or acquiring the object. It suggests that the subject plays a crucial role in making it possible to reach the desired outcome represented by the object.

Predicate-added_to.label: added to
Predicate-added_to.description: The predicate 'added to' indicates a relationship where the subject is incorporated or included within the context of the object, suggesting an enhancement, modification, or extension of the object by the subject. This implies that the subject contributes additional elements, features, or conditions that influence or augment the nature or functionality of the object.

Predicate-used_in.label: used in
Predicate-used_in.description: The predicate 'used in' indicates that the subject is applied or utilized within the context of the object, signifying a functional relationship where the subject serves a purpose or contributes to the processes, activities, or systems represented by the object.

Predicate-can_be_added_to.label: can be added to
Predicate-can_be_added_to.description: The predicate 'can be added to' indicates a relationship where the subject has the potential to be incorporated or included within the framework, system, or context represented by the object. This suggests that the subject enhances, modifies, or contributes to the object, allowing for an expansion or enrichment of the object's characteristics or functionalities.

Predicate-with.label: with
Predicate-with.description: The predicate 'with' indicates a relationship of association or connection between the subject and the object, suggesting that the subject is in some way accompanied by, related to, or in conjunction with the object. It often implies a contextual or situational linkage where the subject's characteristics, properties, or actions are considered in relation to the object.

Predicate-enforces.label: enforces
Predicate-enforces.description: The predicate 'enforces' indicates a relationship where the subject imposes or ensures a certain condition, rule, or standard upon the object, thereby maintaining or establishing a specific state or quality.

Predicate-enforce_consistency_with.label: enforce consistency with
Predicate-enforce_consistency_with.description: The predicate 'enforce consistency with' indicates a relationship where the subject is required to align or conform to the standards, principles, or information represented by the object. This implies that the subject must be adjusted or validated in such a way that it does not contradict or deviate from the expectations or established knowledge encapsulated in the object.

Predicate-make.label: make
Predicate-make.description: The predicate 'make' indicates a process or action through which the subject is transformed, created, or brought into existence in relation to the object. It signifies the relationship where the subject contributes to the formation or realization of the object, often implying a change or development from one state to another.

Predicate-make_useful_tools_for.label: make useful tools for
Predicate-make_useful_tools_for.description: The predicate 'make useful tools for' indicates a relationship where the subject is involved in the creation or development of tools, methods, or resources that serve a practical purpose or enhance the effectiveness of the object. It implies that the subject contributes to the functionality or utility of the object, enabling it to be applied in a meaningful way.

Predicate-improves.label: improves
Predicate-improves.description: The predicate 'improves' indicates a positive enhancement or increase in quality, performance, or effectiveness of the object as a result of the influence or application of the subject. It suggests that the subject contributes to making the object better in some measurable or observable way.

Predicate-incorporates.label: incorporates
Predicate-incorporates.description: The predicate 'incorporates' indicates that the subject includes or integrates the object as a fundamental part or component within its structure or function. It suggests a relationship where the subject actively utilizes or embodies the characteristics, principles, or elements represented by the object, thereby enhancing or modifying its overall nature or operation.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' establishes a hierarchical relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject is a specific instance or subset of the more general concept represented by the object. This relationship implies that the object encompasses a wider range of meanings or applications than the subject, thereby situating the subject within a broader category.
